The Open Brain Project

The Open Brain Project is a collaborative effort among scientists and clinicians to advance understanding of normal and pathological brain function. Our mission is support basic discoveries of brain function that advance patient care and provide a platform for community education and outreach.

Care

  • Program for Translational Brain Mapping

    The program for translational brain mapping brings together clinicians and scientists at the University of Rochester, Carnegie Mellon University and the University of Pittsburgh Medical Center who are committed to the vision of advancing patient care through personalized brain mapping. The Program for Translational Brain Mapping is based in the Department of Neurosurgery at the University of Rochester Medical Center.
